item.title: Kubernetes in Cloud: easy way to deploy an EKS cluster (AWS)
item.description: One of the most used service, to have your Kubernetes cluster deploy in cloud, is the Elastic Kubernetes Service provided by AWS. EKS, defined as containers-as-a-service (CaaS), (more details here regarding pricing and general overview) is a managed service that helps to run Kubernetes on AWS. Practically speaking, you do not need to manage the installation of Kubernetes on EC2 instances but you can leave all the configuration stuff to the services provided by EKS.

item.title: Kubernetes: solutions to deploy it locally
item.description: In this article I want to summarize the most used softwares to deploy a local Kubernetes cluster on your local machine. Having a local deployment of your infrastructure is always a good idea for testing and debugging. There are several platforms you can choose to quickly have your self-hosted Kubernetes. Minikube Minikube is probably the most used choice. It can runs in all the major OS and offers an easy installation guide.
